actor.table_description: the actor table lists information for all actors.

actor_id.description: a surrogate primary key used to uniquely identify each actor in the table.
actor_id.name: actor_id

last_update.description: when the row was created or most recently updated.
last_update.name: last_update

address.table_description: the address table contains address information for customers, staff, and stores.

address.description: the first line of an address
address.name: address

address2.description: an optional second line of an address.
address2.name: address2

address_id.description: a surrogate primary key used to uniquely identify each address in the table.
address_id.name: address_id

city_id.description: a foreign key pointing to the city table.
city_id.name: city_id

district.description: the region of an address, this may be a state, province, prefecture, etc.
district.name: district

last_update.description: when the row was created or most recently updated.
last_update.name: last_update

location.description: a geometry column with a spatial index on it.
location.name: location

phone.description: the telephone number for the address.
phone.name: phone

postal_code.description: the postal code or zip code of the address (where applicable).
postal_code.name: postal_code

category.table_description: the category table lists the categories that can be assigned to a film.

category_id.description: a surrogate primary key used to uniquely identify each category in the table.
category_id.name: category_id

last_update.description: when the row was created or most recently updated.
last_update.name: last_update

city.table_description: the city table contains a list of cities.

city_id.description: a surrogate primary key used to uniquely identify each city in the table.
city_id.name: city_id

country_id.description: a foreign key identifying the country that the city belongs to.
country_id.name: country_id

last_update.description: when the row was created or most recently updated.
last_update.name: last_update

county.table_description: the country table contains a list of countries.

last_update.description: when the row was created or most recently updated.
last_update.name: last_update

customer.table_description: the customer table contains a list of all customers.

active.description: indicates whether the customer is an active customer. setting this to false serves as an alternative to deleting a customer outright.
active.name: active

address_id.description: a foreign key identifying the customer address in the address table.
address_id.name: address_id

create_date.description: the date the customer was added to the system. this date is automatically set using a trigger during an insert.
create_date.name: create_date

customer_id.description: a surrogate primary key used to uniquely identify each customer in the table.
customer_id.name: customer_id

last_update.description: when the row was created or most recently updated.
last_update.name: last_update

store_id.description: a foreign key identifying the customer “home store.” customers are not limited to renting only from this store, but this is the store at which they generally shop.
store_id.name: store_id

film.table_description: the film table is a list of all films potentially in stock in the stores. the actual in-stock copies of each film are represented in the inventory table.

description.description: a short description or plot summary of the film.
description.name: description

film_id.description: a surrogate primary key used to uniquely identify each film in the table.
film_id.name: film_id

language_id.description: a foreign key pointing at the language table
language_id.name: language_id

last_update.description: when the row was created or most recently updated.
last_update.name: last_update

length.description: the duration of the film, in minutes.
length.name: length

original_language_id.description: a foreign key pointing at the language table
original_language_id.name: original_language_id

rating.description: the rating assigned to the film. can be one of: g, pg, pg-13, r, or nc-17.
rating.name: rating

release_year.description: the year in which the movie was released.
release_year.name: release_year

rental_duration.description: the length of the rental period, in days.
rental_duration.name: rental_duration

rental_rate.description: the cost to rent the film for the period specified in the rental_duration column.
rental_rate.name: rental_rate

replacement_cost.description: the amount charged to the customer if the film is not returned or is returned in a damaged state.
replacement_cost.name: replacement_cost

special_features.description: lists which common special features are included on the dvd. can be zero or more of: trailers, commentaries, deleted scenes, behind the scenes.
special_features.name: special_features

film_actor.table_description: the film_actor table is used to support a many-to-many relationship between films and actors.

actor_id.description: a foreign key identifying the actor.
actor_id.name: actor_id

film_id.description: a foreign key identifying the film.
film_id.name: film_id

last_update.description: when the row was created or most recently updated.
last_update.name: last_update

film_category.table_description: the film_category table is used to support a many-to-many relationship between films and categories. for each category applied to a film, there will be one row in the film_category table listing the category and film.

category_id.description: a foreign key identifying the category.
category_id.name: category_id

film_id.description: a foreign key identifying the film.
film_id.name: film_id

last_update.description: when the row was created or most recently updated.
last_update.name: last_update

film_text.table_description: the film_text table contains the film_id, title and description columns of the film table, with the contents of the table kept in synchrony with the film table by means of triggers. on film table insert, update and delete operations

description.description: a short description or plot summary of the film.
description.name: description

film_id.description: a surrogate primary key used to uniquely identify each film in the table.
film_id.name: film_id

inventory.table_description: the inventory table contains one row for each copy of a given film in a given store.

film_id.description: a foreign key pointing to the film this item represents.
film_id.name: film_id

inventory_id.description: a surrogate primary key used to uniquely identify each item in inventory.
inventory_id.name: inventory_id

last_update.description: when the row was created or most recently updated.
last_update.name: last_update

store_id.description: a foreign key pointing to the store stocking this item.
store_id.name: store_id

language.table_description: the language table is a lookup table listing the possible languages that films can have for their language and original language values.

language_id.description: a surrogate primary key used to uniquely identify each language.
language_id.name: language_id

last_update.description: when the row was created or most recently updated.
last_update.name: last_update

name.description: the english name of the language.
name.name: name
